title: Mount Stansfield
text: Mount Stansfield () is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> 2.5 nautical miles (4.6 km) southeast of <a href="Mount%20Berrigan">Mount Berrigan</a> and 20 nautical miles (37 km) west-southwest of <a href="Stor%20Hanakken%20Mountain">Stor Hanakken Mountain</a> in <a href="Enderby%20Land">Enderby Land</a>. It was plotted from air photos taken from ANARE (<a href="Australian%20National%20Antarctic%20Research%20Expeditions">Australian National Antarctic Research Expeditions</a>) aircraft in 1957 and was named by the <a href="Antarctic%20Names%20Committee%20of%20Australia">Antarctic Names Committee of Australia</a> (ANCA) for <a href="P.B.%20Stansfield">P.B. Stansfield</a>, the supervising radio technician at <a href="Wilkes%20Station">Wilkes Station</a> in 1961.
